channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Europe may be too late to stop second wave as cases 'almost back' to March levels
These two things should give people hope, Fauci says
Pelosi says she was 'set up' by hair salon owner
item.description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi responds to Republican backlash to her San Francisco hair salon visit, saying she was "set up" by the owner. CNN's Manu Raju reports.

item.title: Biden meets with Jacob Blake's family as he visits Kenosha
Officers covered head of Black man and held him down before he stopped breathing
item.description: The family of a Black man in Rochester, New York, is calling for the firing and arrest of all of the police officers involved in his death in March, in which they say a bag was placed over his head.

item.title: Markets are flashing a big warning sign
Trump accidentally revealed something very important in a tweet
Barr's response to Trump's claim stuns CNN reporter
item.description: Attorney General Bill Barr appeared to support President Trump's unfounded claim that "thugs" on a plane were traveling to the Republican National Convention to do "big damage."

item.title: It's official: There's no Trump polling bounce out of the conventions
item.description: In the days leading up to the start of the Democratic National Convention in mid-August, CNN's poll of polls -- an aggregate of all credible national surveys -- showed Joe Biden with a 51% to 42% edge over Donald Trump. As of Thursday morning, with both national party conventions behind us, the CNN poll of polls had Biden at 51% to Trump's 43%.

item.title: Police officer poisoned by Novichok in UK issues cryptic tweet on Navalny
item.description: The police officer poisoned with Novichok in the UK in March 2018 has sent a cryptic tweet about the Alexey Navalny case.

item.title: The US is standing firm with Taiwan, and it's making that point very clear
item.description: When a United States guided missile destroyer sailed through the Taiwan Strait on Sunday, it marked the second such transit in less than two weeks -- and among the clearest signals yet of Washington's willingness to stand up for Taiwan in the face of Chinese aggression.

item.title: The pandemic may have just killed overtourism
item.description: Let's journey back to a different time. One that feels far away. Early January 2020.

item.title: Thai King reinstates his royal consort after declaring her 'untainted'
item.description: King Maha Vajiralongkorn of Thailand is welcoming his consort back into the royal household, a surprise move that comes as the country is in the throes of an unprecedented protest movement calling for reforms to both government and the monarchy.

item.title: Cate Blanchett says she's an 'actor not an actress'
item.description: Cate Blanchett says she has always been "an actor."

item.title: Author and activist known for popularizing phrase 'We are the 99%' dies
item.description: David Graeber, an anthropologist and a leading figure of the Occupy Wall Street movement, has died, his wife told CNN. He was 59.

item.title: MacKenzie Scott has become the world's richest woman
item.description: MacKenzie Scott — philanthropist, author and ex-wife of Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos — is now the wealthiest woman in the world.

item.title: 'That's just weird': CNN's Keilar debunks Jackson's claim
item.description: Ronny Jackson spoke out about the President's 2019 visit to Walter Reed hospital in addition to commenting on his and Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden's health. CNN's Brianna Keilar fact-checks President Donald Trump's former physician.

item.title: Facebook will let US politicians lie in ads through Election Day
item.description: In an attempt to combat efforts to undermine the US presidential election in November, Facebook on Thursday took several steps it says will address concerns about election interference on its platform.

item.title: Japan searches for missing ship carrying 5,800 cows and 43 sailors
item.description: A lone sailor has been rescued from the dark waters of the Pacific Ocean after a cargo ship with 43 people aboard went missing during Typhoon Maysak, according to the Japan Coast Guard.

item.title: Heartbreaking eviction brings mover to tears
item.description: CNN's Kyung Lah speaks with residents in Houston who are facing financial hardship as a result of the coronavirus pandemic. Unable to pay their rent, they now face eviction.

item.title: Miley Cyrus opens up about marriage to Liam Hemsworth
item.description: Miley Cyrus' breakup with Liam Hemsworth didn't happen the way you might believe.

item.title: 'No Time To Die' trailer is a wild ride around the world
item.description: The trailer for "No Time To Die" has dropped -- and the franchise looks better than ever.

item.title: Store owner rejects Trump's invite. See who appeared with him instead
item.description: A store owner in Kenosha, Wisconsin, whose store was destroyed by rioters following the shooting of Jacob Blake explains why he rejected President Trump's invitation to tour the damage. CNN affiliate WTMJ reports.

item.title: Endangered gorillas experience unprecedented baby boom
item.description: Uganda's Bwindi Impenetrable National Park is experiencing an unprecedented baby boom in its mountain gorilla population after seven infants were born so far this year, compared to two in the whole of 2019, according to officials.

item.title: Plants could help authorities detect dead human bodies in woodland
item.description: Plants could help detect human remains in dense forest areas because of the way vegetation behaves around decomposing bodies, researchers hope.

item.title: Changing the clocks is a bad idea — and it should end, sleep experts say
item.description: Changing the clocks twice a year is intended to save energy, but there is a growing consensus that it comes at the cost of human lives.

item.title: Former aide to Melania Trump describes relationship between Melania and Ivanka
item.description: Stephanie Winston Wolkoff, former friend and aide to first lady Melania Trump, speaks to CNN's Alisyn Camerota about the relationship between Melania and her stepdaughter Ivanka Trump.

item.title: Vast size of prehistoric megalodon shark, which had a fin as long as a human, revealed for the first time
item.description: The true size of a gigantic prehistoric megalodon shark that ruled the oceans millions of years ago has been revealed for the first time -- and it had teeth as big as hands, and a fin as tall as a human adult.

item.title: Muguruza delivers epic racket smash
item.description: Garbine Muguruza lost her racket and her US Open match Thursday against a tricky foe who returned to the circuit this week after becoming a mom.

item.title: Tatooine-like exoplanet may be in orbit
item.description: When Luke Skywalker emerges from his home at dusk on the planet Tatooine in "Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope," he watches twin suns setting in the sky. The two suns are misaligned, with one lower in the sky than the other.

item.title: Fisherman catches a live pipe bomb
item.description: A fisherman was surprised when he pulled a pipe bomb from the water on the Sacramento River in California.

item.title: Neymar reportedly one of the three PSG players to test positive for Covid-19
item.description: Brazilian international Neymar is one of three Paris Saint-Germain players to have tested positive for Covid-19, according to multiple reports.

item.title: 'Steep rise' in racism and homophobia in UK soccer
item.description: There has been a "steep rise" in the levels of discrimination around English football, according to anti-racism group Kick It Out.

item.title: Venice Film Festival 2020: Best fashion (and face masks) on the red carpet
item.description: The red carpet at this year's Venice Film Festival is proving to be unlike any before it, with celebrities arriving on the island of Lido in face masks and gowns to a muted reception.

item.title: $10M 'dream coin' goes up for sale again
item.description: A rare 1794 Silver Dollar believed to be one of the first -- if not the first -- to be struck by the US Mint is going up for sale.

item.title: Pilots report man flying a jetpack above Los Angeles
item.description: An unusual call came into the Los Angeles airport concerning an unidentified man flying a jetpack. CNN affiliate KCBS/KCAL has the story.

item.title: Lili Reinhart 'feels like a prisoner' returning to 'Riverdale' set
item.description: Lili Reinhart is grateful for her gig on "Riverdale," but not thrilled about going back to work.

item.title: Rory McIlroy and wife Erica Stoll welcome baby girl
item.description: Rory McIlroy and wife Erica Stoll welcomed a baby girl into the world on Monday.

item.title: Messi's father confirms he's exploring option of remaining at Barcelona
item.description: Lionel Messi's father and agent has confirmed that he's exploring the option of the Barcelona talisman staying at the club for one more year.

item.title: PGA Tour 'expects to generate over $100m' towards racial and social injustice causes
item.description: PGA Tour commissioner Jay Monahan says that he expects the Tour to raise over $100 million towards racial and social injustice causes over the next 10 years.

item.title: Why new hotels are opening amid the pandemic
item.description: To say that Covid-19 has hurt the hotel industry, along with travel as a whole, is something of an understatement.

item.title: Pro ski champion lives double life as social media star
item.description: Balancing a career in professional sport with being a social media sensation is a tightrope to walk.

item.title: A drop in travel helps the planet. But there's a catch
item.description: With global travel largely on pause during the Covid-19 pandemic, some cities and companies see an opportunity to rethink tourism with the planet's health in mind.

item.title: Coronavirus cases across the continent are 'almost back' to the levels seen in March, scientists warn
item.description: Coronavirus cases in Europe are "almost back" to the levels seen in March when infection rates first peaked, scientists have warned as concerns grow over a potential second wave.

item.title: Fauci: More data needed on this Covid-19 treatment
Doctors warn against rushing a Covid-19 vaccine
item.description: Just because states should have a plan for vaccine distribution doesn't mean the public should expect to get shots this fall, doctors say.

item.title: Reports show White House coronavirus task force mask mandate was ignored by some states
item.description: The White House coronavirus task force gave increasingly urgent recommendations to states about masks over the summer, only to have them mostly ignored by six states, their weekly reports show.

item.title: Wear a mask while having sex and avoid kissing new people, top doctor advises
item.description: Sex in a pandemic can be complicated, Canada's lead medical doctor says, and it's best to skip kissing and perhaps wear a mask to prevent spreading Covid-19.

item.title: Markets are flashing a big warning sign
item.description: • Stocks have worst day in three months

item.title: Trump accidentally revealed something important in tweet
item.description: On any given day, President Donald Trump will tweet or retweet dozens -- and sometimes hundreds -- of things. Most of this stuff is either celebratory of something he did (or didn't do) or just the sort of standard-issue propaganda that your average conservative internet troll might produce.
